title: Why is it that people I report never get punished
body: I can copy paste exactly where they were harassing other people in the chat but they always get by. What the fuck.

replies.body: I've heard you only get the notification if you were the most recent person to report them. But I don't know if that is accurate or not.
I remember reading about that on a different thread I just don't know if it's true or not. Pretty dumb if it is.

> [{quoted}](name=Ramen226,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3EJsvwGF,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-03-27T20:57:55.937+0000)
>
> I remember reading about that on a different thread I just don't know if it's true or not.

It is indeed the case. I'm not sure about *most* recent, but it at least needs to be in the game that triggered the punishment.

This is probably so that you get immediate feedback. It would be a little odd and disconnected to see, say, a message if you hadn't reported anyone in a month and some guy you forgot about but reported a month ago finally pushed over the line.
Dude I'd just be happy to get the msg. "Some dickhead you played with at some point got punished." WHo the hell wouldn't wanna get that lol
How do you know they aren't getting punished?

I'm not getting the message that says they've been punished and depending on what they were doing I'll look at their match history the next day. I've never gotten a notification for someone inting and for someone harassing it's about 3 times in a few years of playing. Does the report button actually do anything?

I mean it has to do something, otherwise you wouldn't see all these threads of people complaining about being banned. I think you only get a notification sometimes, if the person receives a suspension. So if they receive any of the chat restrictions  you wont be notified about it.

That's pretty dumb imo. I'd say the main reason anyone has ever reported another person was so they can get the message. I've only ever gotten the same person 2 games in a row out of my time playing so there's really no point in reporting them at all unless you get at least a little satisfaction from it.

They made it so that you only get the notification if your report was the one that triggered the punishment (to be more accurate, all reports made on the same game are treated as one, so more than one person may receive the popup) because otherwise it would be too spammy. You'd be getting feedback popups all the time to the point of annoyance.

QQ post

/makes a new acc for many reasons, 1 being the possibility of reaching low to nonexistent weight reports, due to useless en mass reporting, due to having an afk/troll/inter in 90% of the games; afkers/feeders on the enemy team are never in 2 games in a row (I know this because I've been looking for this situation for many months now, aka for a time where I actually get lucky, as so many people state the statistics are in the favor of us non trolls), but quite often on the allied team multiple games in a row, win or loss, ranked, or norms, and even aram, where it USED to be my safe place
/has 2 afks in first human vs human game on a newly created fresh account... what are the odds, God?!
/decides to mute all chat preventively to reduce incoming toxicity and temptation of replying
/decides to randomly mute all team mates to reduce toxicity even more
/decides not to report as to keep the weight of reporting high for those times that really matter (if there is such a time)
/still encounters afks and inters, ofc
/goes to aram cus ip is same, champ select shorter, and finds same toxicity when not muting everyone
/still in aram, encounters a feeder using 'kys' and insulting everybody at least once, so decides not to report cus surely someone else will (if the system cannot detect a 1v5'ing, 1/18 ori)
/doesn't start a new game right after, in fear of not getting qd with same arse
/still gets put on same team with that arse
/recognizes the arse by their feeding and what have now become their staple phrases, and warns others naive enough to reply to them that they have to mute and be prepared for more feeding
/stops for the day, not without asking God: how the fk and why
I thought for a second that you were calling MY post a qq post. Yeah man i feels you. Report system is ineffective. #ReworkReportSystem

Because riot has gone to a computer system that can easily be tricked.  
First off, it doesn't punish someone for ONE game like it used to.. they have to do that in at least 2 games..  How do I know? I've actually followed people on other websites that have cursed excessively as well as using a new account to test out the theory  (making a summoners name so offensive but changing certain spellings) that turned out to be correct.. (I will not post the name of the champion I made because it violates the board but it starts with the N word.. )

Second. Ritos notification window is currently messed up.  I just got back from a 2 week myself (3 games in a row of the same int feeder and I finally had it) 
and it's STILL showing me the 2 week notice 3 days later.. I'm doing good right now I don't need to be harrassed riot every time I log on to play now :P

Riot's got... Problems that needs resolved internally. Just a lot of stuff really and they never want to admit it. Or if they do its always a, "Yeah we fucked up, but we're not gonna listen to the community about it we're just gonna leave it be/minor alterations until everyone shuts up about it." Not the least of which being their attitude towards toxic behaviors. : /

The in game notification is for the instantaneous punishment that is dealt with through clear indicators like AFKing and getting caught by both leavebuster and by your report, or or excessive use of flagged words and phrases that are clearly meant to harass.

You don't know if they're punished for other things and you ultimately have no right to know if they do get punished. It's not your business. I know you want to know that people are getting what they deserve, but you actually don't have a right to know even if you were the target of the harassment or horrible behavior of that person.
